H0.text: Heat flows from the tea to the ice when an ice cube is placed in a cup of hot tea.

H1.text: Cold flows from the ice to the tea when an ice cube is placed in a cup of hot tea.

H2.text: Cold flows from the ice, and heat flows from the tea is the statement that describes the transfer of energy when an ice cube is placed in a cup of hot tea.

H3.text: Heat flows simultaneously between the ice and the tea when an ice cube is placed in a cup of hot tea.

A4.text: Heat is conducted from a hotter body to a colder body.

A5.text: Heat spontaneously flows along a temperature gradient.
